eecs2311simulator

Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • eecs2311simulator.Simulator

  • public class Simulator
extends java.lang.Object
    A simulator that was designed to simulate the hardware of a device that will be used to teach young, vision-impaired adolescents how to read and understand Braille characters.

    The index of the cells start from 0 .. (number of cells - 1), where the total number of cells subtracted by 1 represents the last Braille cell displayed on the simulator.
    The index of the JButtons start from 0 .. (number of JButtons - 1), where the total number of JButtons subtracted by 1 represent the last JButton displayed on the simulator.

    In addition, the numbering of the cells starts from the left-most cell.
    The same applies to the JButtons, as numbering starts from the left-most JButton.

    For the pins of the Braille cells, the pin number starts at 0 which represents the top left pin while the bottom right pin represents the total number of pins subtracted by 1.

    A visual image is included for both the 6 and 8 pins to understand how the pin numbers work:
                         
       |   0    1   |     8-pin Braille cell with corresponding pin numbering.
       |   2    3   |
       |   4    5   |
       |   6    7   |


                         
       |   0    1   |     6-pin Braille cell with corresponding pin numbering.
       |   2    3   |
       |   4    5   |

    Author:
    Team 3 of EECS 2311 Winter 2017

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Simulator()
      Creates a JFrame GUI with one 8-pin Braille cell and one JButton.
      Simulator(boolean sixOrEight)
      Creates a JFrame GUI with either one 8-pin or 6-pin Braille cell and one JButton.
      Simulator(boolean sixOrEight, int cellsNum, int buttonsNum)
      Creates a JFrame GUI with cellsNum number of 8-pin or 6-pin Braille cells and buttonsNum number of JButtons.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Simulator

        public Simulator()
        Creates a JFrame GUI with one 8-pin Braille cell and one JButton.
        By default, all pins on the Braille cell are initially lowered.

      • Simulator

        public Simulator(boolean sixOrEight)
        Creates a JFrame GUI with either one 8-pin or 6-pin Braille cell and one JButton.
        By default, all pins on the Braille cell are initially lowered.
        Parameters:
        sixOrEight - Set to true for an 8-pin Braille cell or false for a 6-pin Braille cell

      • Simulator

        public Simulator(boolean sixOrEight,
                 int cellsNum,
                 int buttonsNum)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a JFrame GUI with cellsNum number of 8-pin or 6-pin Braille cells and buttonsNum number of JButtons.
        By default, all pins on the Braille cells are initially lowered.
        Parameters:
        sixOrEight - Set to true for the Braille cells to be 8-pin or false for the Braille cells to be 6-pin
        cellsNum - Number of Braille cells to be displayed
        buttonsNum - Number of JButtons to be displayed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If cellsNum or buttonsNum is < 1

    • Method Detail

      • checkPinRaised

        public boolean checkPinRaised(int brailleCellNum,
                              int pinNum)
                       throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Checks to see if the specified pin number at the specified Braille cell is raised.
        Parameters:
        brailleCellNum - The index of the Braille cell that contains the pin to be checked
        pinNum - The index of the pin to be checked
        Returns:
        True if the specified pin is raised, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= getBrailleCellsSize ())

      • getBrailleCellsSize

        public int getBrailleCellsSize()
        Returns the total number of Braille cells that are being displayed.
        Returns:
        The total number of Braille cells. Total number of Braille cells is >= 1

      • getButton

        public javax.swing.JButton getButton(int buttonNum)
                              throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns access to the individual JButton objects
        Parameters:
        buttonNum - The index of the JButton to get
        Returns:
        The JButton object at the specified position
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is out of range (buttonNum < 0 || buttonNum >= getButtonsSize ())

      • getButtonsSize

        public int getButtonsSize()
        Returns the total number of JButtons that are being displayed.
        Returns:
        The total number of JButtons. Total number of JButtons is >= 1

      • getSize

        public java.awt.Dimension getSize()
        Returns the size of the JFrame.
        Returns:
        Size of the JFrame storing the visual elements

      • lowerPin

        public void lowerPin(int brailleCellNum,
                     int pinNum)
              throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Lowers the pin of the specified pin at the specified Braille cell.
        Parameters:
        brailleCellNum - The index of the Braille cell that contains the pin to be lowered
        pinNum - The index of the pin to lower
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is out of range (indexCell < 0 || indexCell >= getBrailleCellsSize ())
        Or if the index of the pin is out of range (indexPin < 0 || indexPin >= 8) for 8 pin cells or (indexPin < 0 || indexPin >= 6) for 6 pin cells

      • raisePin

        public void raisePin(int brailleCellNum,
                     int pinNum)
              throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Raises the pin of the specified pin at the specified Braille cell.
        Parameters:
        brailleCellNum - The index of the Braille cell that contains the pin to be raised
        pinNum - The index of the pin to raise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is out of range (indexCell < 0 || indexCell >= getBrailleCellsSize ())
        Or if the index of the pin is out of range (indexPin < 0 || indexPin >= 8) for 8 pin cells or (indexPin < 0 || indexPin >= 6) for 6 pin cells

      • reset

        public void reset(int brailleCellNum)
           throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Lowers all the pins of the specified Braille cell, thereby resetting it back to its original state.
        Parameters:
        brailleCellNum - The index of the Braille cell to reset the pins to lowered
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= getBrailleCellsSize ())

      • setCharToBraillePins

        public void setCharToBraillePins(int brailleCellNum,
                                 char character)
                          throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the corresponding Braille character for the specified letter for the specified Braille cell.
        Parameters:
        brailleCellNum - The index of the Braille cell to display the Braille character
        character - The English letter to be displayed onto the Braille cell
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= getBrailleCellsSize ())
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the input of character is not a valid letter of the English alphabet

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int width,
                    int height)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Changes the size of the window of the simulator.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the window to be changed to
        height - The height of the window to be changed to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Width must be at least 500 and height must be at least 500
